name: Formatting of declarations should be consistent
htmlDesc:
For readability reasons, a declaration should comply to the following format:

  • The property and the value should be defined on the same line
  • There should not be any whitespace between the property and the colon
  • There should be one single whitespace between the colon and the value

Noncompliant Code Example

h1 {  color:red;        /* Noncompliant: missing whitespace between colon and value */}h1 {  color:    red;    /* Noncompliant: too many whitespaces between colon and value */}h1 {  color : red;      /* Noncompliant: unexpected whitespace between property and value */}h1 {  color:    red;            /* Noncompliant: property and value not defined on the same line */}

Compliant Solution

h1 {  color: red;}
